abstract: Michael Mayo, a day before JPMorgan Chase’s investor conference, argues that the bank might be worth more to shareholders as individual businesses than as one huge company.
snippet: Michael Mayo, a day before JPMorgan Chase’s investor conference, argues that the bank might be worth more to shareholders as individual businesses than as one huge company.
lead_paragraph: A day before JPMorgan Chase’s annual investor conference, Michael Mayo, an analyst with Crédit Agricole Securities and author of “Exile on Wall Street,” is wondering aloud if the firm might be better off as firms, plural.

headline.main: Dividing Dimon? Analyst Offers Case for a JPMorgan Split
